sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The French King's new declaration an edict of the King, declaring that the next of kin and lawful heirs of such persons as are fled for their religion, shall enter into possession of the estates and goods which they have left behind in the kingdom, yet without any power to sell of alienate them, till after the expiration of five years. Given at Versailles, in the month of December 1689. Register'd in Parliament, Decemb. 9. 1689. Licens'd December 7. 1689. J.F. France. Sovereign (1643-1715 : Louis XIV) Louis XIV, King of France, 1638-1715.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
printed for Ben[net] Griffin, at the sign of the Griffin in the Old-Bayly, London : 1689.
Bookseller's name from Wing CD-ROM, 1996. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Given at Versailles, in the month of December 1689. Register'd in Parliament, Decemb. 9. 1689. Licens'd December 7. 1689. J.F. France.
